my_notes: Hints of chocolate and berry. Nice finish LK. This is a lovely rich Merlot from grapes grown on a steep hillside 200 feet above the Russian River Valley.  It shows ripe black cherry with hints of black currants, toasted almond and chocolate.  It has been aged primarily in French oak and is a limited production

my_notes: Soft, lush with fruit. This highly extracted Syrah has been grown in a fairly warm climate and reminds us of an Australian Shiraz from Barossa.  It exudes rich chocolate and blackberry aromas, with hints of anise, toasted almond and vanilla.  The ripe meaty currant and black cherry flavors have a long lingering aftertaste.

Soft, lush with fruit. This highly extracted Syrah has been grown in a fairly warm climate and reminds us of an Australian Shiraz from Barossa.  It exudes rich chocolate and blackberry aromas, with hints of anise, toasted almond and vanilla.  The ripe meaty currant and black cherry flavors have a long lingering aftertaste.

other_notes: The 2000 Quilceda Creek Cabernet Sauvignon is reminiscent of the '98 Quilceda Creek but on steroids. This wine is packed full of blackberry liqueur, plums, and crème de cassis laden with anise, smoke and Asian spices. It has a fabulous syrupy texture, show-casing the amazing purity of cabernet fruit found in this wine. It is the most perfumed and well-balanced Quilceda Creek wine to date.  The dark ruby-colored 2000 Cabernet Sauvignon has a nose reminiscent of a blackberry-flavored Yoplait yogurt laced with roasted oak and hints of licorice. A full-bodied wine of power and structure, it is crammed with black currants, blackberries, and spices. Its dense fruit is matched blow for blow with a muscular, firm structure. Anticipated maturity: 2008-2020. Score: 94+

The 2000 Quilceda Creek Cabernet Sauvignon is reminiscent of the '98 Quilceda Creek but on steroids. This wine is packed full of blackberry liqueur, plums, and crème de cassis laden with anise, smoke and Asian spices. It has a fabulous syrupy texture, show-casing the amazing purity of cabernet fruit found in this wine. It is the most perfumed and well-balanced Quilceda Creek wine to date.  The dark ruby-colored 2000 Cabernet Sauvignon has a nose reminiscent of a blackberry-flavored Yoplait yogurt laced with roasted oak and hints of licorice. A full-bodied wine of power and structure, it is crammed with black currants, blackberries, and spices. Its dense fruit is matched blow for blow with a muscular, firm structure. Anticipated maturity: 2008-2020. Score: 94+

winemaker: Madame Louis Ducasse et Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite)

other_notes: Robert Parker, The Wine Advocate, 28-08-92  93 Points. “The 1990 Symington's Quinta do Vesuvio possesses an opaque black/purple colour, and a sweet, rich nose with a whiff of liquorice and powerfully ripe fruit. In the mouth it is full-bodied, with superb concentration, as well as a rich, opulent, deep finish. Drinkable now, it has at least 20 years of evolution. Just as spectacular as any Vintage Port I have tasted from 1983 or 1985.” Michael Broadbent MW, Decanter Magazine, December 1992 “Impressive....virtually opaque, with a vivid purple rim so intense that it seemed to be exerting pressure against the sides of the glass. ......black, fiery, peppery, alcoholic, its sweetness masked by packed fruit, high extract and dry, mouth-puckering tannins”

Robert Parker, The Wine Advocate, 28-08-92  93 Points. “The 1990 Symington's Quinta do Vesuvio possesses an opaque black/purple colour, and a sweet, rich nose with a whiff of liquorice and powerfully ripe fruit. variety: Bordeaux (60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Franc, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon)
other_notes: 100 points Robert Parker: "Give Gerard Perse credit. People thought his numerous assurances that 2000 was the greatest Pavie ever produced were premature as well as arrogant. However, after tasting this extraordinary blend of 60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Franc, and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon (made from low yields of 28-30 hectoliters per hectare) six separate times in 2003, it is unquestionably one of the most monumental wines Bordeaux has ever produced. Bottled in March, 2003, about nine months later than other 2000s, the color is an opaque purple, and the bouquet offers up notes of liquid minerals, blackberries, cherries, and cassis intermixed with spice box, cedar, and white flowers. On the palate, it exhibits a massive display of richness and extract, yet with pinpoint delineation and vibrancy as well as a 60+ second finish, this is the kind of phenomenal wine that Perse's critics were afraid he might produce - a no-compromise, immortal wonder that represents the essence of one of Bordeaux's greatest terroirs. Life is too short not to own and consume the 2000 Pavie. Anticipated maturity: 2012-2050." (04/03)

other_notes: From bottle:  Our Apalita estate is located in Santa Cruz in the heart of the Colchagua Valley, one of the best winemaking areas in Chile for red wines.  The melting snow from the Andes Mountains temper the heat of the summer sun and nourish the vines that were originally brought into the country during the XIX century from France, pre-phyloxera.

From bottle:  Our Apalita estate is located in Santa Cruz in the heart of the Colchagua Valley, one of the best winemaking areas in Chile for red wines.  The melting snow from the Andes Mountains temper the heat of the summer sun and nourish the vines that were originally brought into the country during the XIX century from France, pre-phyloxera.

From the bottle:  Many fine Napa Valley vineyards added thier individual character to this wine.  French oak barrel fermentation, aging on the lees and malolactic fermentation contributed to the wine’s richness and long, silky finish.

other_notes: From bottle:  This wine is a study in drupe fruits - blackberry and huckleberry figuring most prominently.  Shockingly deep in color, this wine is a superb complement to all manner of pomodoro-infused cuisine and is absolutely brilliant with pasta.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2001 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes from the process of charring the barrel heads for caramelized oak tones.

NVWE:  CLEARLY IDENTIFIABLE AS CARNEROS CHARDONnay in both aroma and taste, this well stuffed beauty leaves the drinker with lingering impressions of baked apple, citrus, golden fig, vanilla, and tropical fruits, using subtle earthiness and zest to keep the palate alert.

NVWE:  We found this one bright, ripe and gently spicy in aroma, and its well-focused gooseberry, melon, lime, honeysuckle and preserved lemon notes are reprised on the palate, but with more intensity, depth and generosity.  Blended with 10% Semillon

NVWE Luxurious all the way; from it’s richly oaky peach-apple-lemon-toasted coconut scents to its long and wonderfully creamy finish where white peach, golden fig, baked apple, lemon, bees wax and vanilla butter cream all play a role.

NVWE:  Elegantly aromatic and caressing to the nose, offering melon, honeydew and peach blossom scents softly graced by vanilla and a hint of clove, it will prove a pert and cuddly sipper and worthy match to winter’s richer chicken and pork dishes.  Blended with 3% Chardonnay

NVWE:  Zesty, fruit dominated, grapefruit, melon and key lime aromas don’t disguise the bold mineral core that brands this Sauvignon Blanc as a classic seafood wine.  Give it barbecued prawns, steamed clams, raw oysters or sushi.

NVWE:  A cascade of fresh peach, lime, jasmine, yellow rose and lychee fruit scents bring drama to the nose, but it is the exquisite length, depth of flavor and pinpoint balance that make this a truly splendid dinner wine.

NVWE:  Supple and polished all the way, this lovely Cabernet accents a rich fruit core of blackberry and plum with black tea, dried herbs and a hint of coffee toffee.  It is not grand in scale but is deep and satisfying and the flavors and silky texture linger beautifully.

NVWE:  Full of dark plum, cherry, currant and toasty vanilla to the nose, this supple and tasty Cabernet has the zest for sauced meats, enough stuffing for a rich roast, but a tannic edge soft enough to comfortably match roast chicken or sausage pizza.

my_notes: Nice, rich sweetness.  Alan says “It’s good.”
other_notes: NVWE comments:  Darkly rich and sweetly ripe, this intense and juicy Zin fills the nose with dark cherry, black fig, black pepper, smoke, earth and other savory treats.  Perfect for beef, it is as boldly flavored as expected and fully dry, with the balance of a fine dinner wine.  Unfined and unfiltered.

NVWE comments:  This deeply ripe mountain Merlot has focused aromas and flavors of sweet dark cherry, red currant, sumac, briar and earth.  Long and gusty and flavorful, it deserves service with a rich roast or grilled steak and it should only get better over the next two years.

NVWE comments:  Grapey, sweet-natured and delightful, with scents and flavors of black raspberry, pepper, date sugar and dry flowers that just jump from the glass.  A perfect steak and burger wine, soft-edged sipper and God’s gift to pizza make this a bargain not to be missed.  Blended with 5% Malbec

NVWE comments:  A wine of the Fall, not the Spring, this Pinot offers layered, subtly herbal tones of ripe Bing cherry, dry rose, dry fruit and a hint of slightly peppery roast meat.  Palate-coating and long, it’s impression of plush complexity suggests service with rich stews.

From bottle:  Katherine’s Chardonnay represents the signature style of Cambria’s family-owned estate.  Located in the heart of the Santa Maria Bench, Katherine’s has consistenly produced lush, tropical Chardonnays for over a decade.

my_notes: Very light and fruity.  Color is almost a blush.  Alan says that the aftertaste is redolent of cough syrup but not in a bad way.  I agree.
other_notes: From bottle:  Ripe cherry flavors, soft vanillin-oak, and bright, balanced acidity make this award-wining wine - food perfect!

my_notes: Very light and fruity.  Color is almost a blush.  Alan says that the aftertaste is redolent of cough syrup but not in a bad way.  I agree.
other_notes: From bottle:  Ripe cherry flavors, soft vanillin-oak, and bright, balanced acidity make this award-wining wine - food perfect!

my_notes: Jammy, lots of fruit,hint of vanilla

vineyard: Gum Tree Ranch very old vines
Gum Tree Ranch very old vines

other_notes: The rust-red stony soils of our southerly sloping mountain top vineyard impart profound depth of color and expression of ripe fruit and terroire in the 2001 vintage.
The rust-red stony soils of our southerly sloping mountain top vineyard impart profound depth of color and expression of ripe fruit and terroire in the 2001 vintage.
The rust-red stony soils of our southerly sloping mountain top vineyard impart profound depth of color and expression of ripe fruit and terroire in the 2001 vintage.

vineyard: Leonardini and Morisoli Vineyards for 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, Small vineyard block in Calistoga for Petite Verdot 6%
other_notes: Wine Spectator 93. 2000 presented a stunning growing season of warm days and cool nights. There was excellent grape flavor and acid development as the grapes ripened sweetly and evenly into September. In September and October, the weather cooled, delaying the ripening process. This cooler Fall weather gave the grapes longer hang time in the vineyard for added flavor development. The result is very good balance and soft, ripe tannin development. This classic Cabernet is easily approachable with a deep ruby color and enticing aromas of red cherry,currant and spicy oak. The texture of this wine is silky smooth on the mid-palate with ripe flavors of cassis, berry and cherry lingering well beyond the long velvety finish. There is outstanding balance and good structure that lends to the age worthiness of this elegant offering. A real mouthful of Cabernet. Ripe, rich and plush, with mouthcoating currant and blackberry flavors that are deep and concentrated. Echoes with spicy fruit, and is anchored by rich, chewy tannins.

vineyard: Leonardini and Morisoli Vineyards for 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, Small vineyard block in Calistoga for Petite Verdot 6%

The bouquet has lifted fruit flavours, while the palate displays typical Barossa varietal Shiraz characters of chocolate and plum fruit.  Expert use of oak has resulted in subtle vanillin flavors.

variety: Cuvée Blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, and Petit Verdot
other_notes: An elegant, distinctive wine displaying berry fruit flavors layered with plum and cherry spice characters.  The Petit Verdot adds an appealing floral life to the wine.

A nice Chardonnay with a smooth finish.  Hints of apple.  Alan says "I liked it.  It's worth getting again.”

variety: Meritage  Malbec 42%, Petit Verdot 42%, Cabernet Sauvignon 12% and Merlot 4%
other_notes: From bottle:  Toasted Head Meritage, a belnd based on two uncommon Bordeaux varietals, has pure flavors of blackberry and dried cherry, notes of chocolate and black pepper, fromed by elegant tannins.  Enjoy now or cellar for 5 - 10 years.
The 2000 Toasted Head Merlot has layers of ripe cherry, dark roasted coffee and vanilla with herb and spice highlights.  Tannins are firm and balanced.

winery: Hawk Crest by Stag’s Leap Wine Cellars

other_notes: Low Yields, ripe fruit, and simple winemaking have combined to create this inky, glass-staining, decadent wine,.
Low Yields, ripe fruit, and simple winemaking have combined to create this inky, glass-staining, decadent wine,.
Low Yields, ripe fruit, and simple winemaking have combined to create this inky, glass-staining, decadent wine,.

Grapes were grown primarily on our 120 year old estate in the acclaimed reigon of Sonoma County’s Alexander Valley, and showcawse classic flavors of balck cherry, vanilla, and chocolate.  Additional fruit came from the southern end of the valley, unleashing flavors of blackberry and cassis.  Winemaker Ed Killiam aged the wine for 22 months in small oak barrels to compose this rich, succulent wine that gracefully lingers

vineyard: Russian River Valley, Alexander Valley and Carneros
other_notes: Winemaker Ed Killian chose grapes from three of Sonoma County’s acclaimed wine grwoing regions to create this multi-layered Chardonnay:  Russian River Valley for honeysuckle floral aromas and tropical fruit flavors; Alexander Valley for pear and peach flavors; Carneros for its ripe apple and lemon-citrus.  French barrel fermentation adds nuances of toasty oak and spice.

my_notes: Grassy, dry, small butter

purchased_from: Gift to Laureen from Jim and Linda

other_notes: From bottle:  Aromas of spicy fruit liquorice and oak typical of this variety of grape.   Lovely big wine has lingering sublet peppery characteristics and flavoursome red berry overtones.  Youthful and fresh with good finish.

my_notes: Kosher for Passover
other_notes: From the bottle:  The 2000 vintage was handled with some difficulty as there was light sporadic rain at the end of the season.  We were blessed by a window of clear, dry weather that allowed the fruit to reach full maturity.  Consequently, this wine is balanced and well structured.  The flavor and mouth feel is enhanced by 18 months of aging in new American oak barrels.  Look for the Alexander Valley fruit aromas of green pepper, beet, blackberry and cassis.  Because the wine has a nice soft mouth feel, it can be enjoyed now with most chicken, grilled meats or hard cheese.  If you would like to age the wine, under proper conditions, it should develop additional complexity.  It may form some sediment as it ages.
...shows exciting varietal intensity of fresh green lime and grapefruit aromas, refreshing citrus and crisp acidity on the palate with an attractive lingering finish.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2001 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes from the process of charring the barrel heads for caramelized oak tones.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2001 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes from the process of charring the barrel heads for caramelized oak tones.

my_notes: Went very well with Tuna/Spaghetti/Fresh sauce.  Grassy, pleasant
other_notes: From bottle:  This superbly versatile St. Supéry Sauvignon Blanc from Napa Valley vineyards shows exciting varietal intensity of fresh green lime and grapefruit aromas, refreshing citrus and crisp acidity on the palate with an attractive lingering finish.

From bottle:  This superbly versatile St. Supéry Sauvignon Blanc from Napa Valley vineyards shows exciting varietal intensity of fresh green lime and grapefruit aromas, refreshing citrus and crisp acidity on the palate with an attractive lingering finish.

winery: Goat-Roti Charles Back and the Fairview Flock
Goat-Roti Charles Back and the Fairview Flock

other_notes: Since 1869 premium grapes have been grown on historic Summit Ranch atop Spring Mountain.  These mountain vineyards grow at an elevation of 2,100 feet and overlook the famous Napa and Sonoma Valleys from the summit.  This mountian Syrah is grown on our Quartz Hill where well-drained soils intensify the color and aromatic character of this Rhone varietal.  This vintage produced fewer than 400 cases.

These mountain vineyards grow at an elevation of 2,100 feet and overlook the famous Napa and Sonoma Valleys from the summit.  This mountian Syrah is grown on our Quartz Hill where well-drained soils intensify the color and aromatic character of this Rhone varietal.  This vintage produced fewer than 400 cases.

my_notes: Need to return one of the Monte Rosso for Napa Valley
other_notes: Charter Oak Winery Zinfandel is handcrafted in keeping with the Old World tradition passed down by (my) Grandfather Guido Ragghianti, who learned to make wine as a young man in Lucca Italy.  In the 1930s he brought his winemaking heritage to Charter Oak Avenue, St. Helena, in the heart of Napa Valley.  The wine is fermented on natural yeasts, and the cap is punched down by hand several times a day with special tools made by my grandfather.   Our grapes come from the famed Monte Rosso Vineyard of Sonoma Valley planted in the 1880s.   by winemaker

This is a big, thick, juicy, jammy, seductive blackberry-scented Napa Zin, including fruit from Charter Oak vineyard, with layers of lush fruit and well-integrated toasty French oak. The 2002 Napa is blended with old vine Petite Syrah (1/2 ton per acre) from an historic St. Helena vineyard for added muscle and Zinfandel from the famed Monte Rosso vineyard for added wild berry flavors. This wine has a dark chocolate, Bing cherry, black berry liquor velvet finish and is elegant in style. Only 300 cases produced, limited availability. Aged exclusively in 100% new French oak Burgundy barrels.

my_notes: Had a bottle on 12/09/2007, wait till late 2008 or 2009 at least.
Had a bottle on 12/09/2007, wait till late 2008 or 2009 at least.

other_notes: This wine has a wonderful texture showcasing layers of black and red fruits interwoven with cocoa powder, leather, vanilla, and minerals. This is an amazing wine that must be tasted again and again. The dark ruby-colored 2001 Cabernet Sauvignon (3,150 cases) contains 3% Cabernet Franc. This spectacular wine explodes from the glass with loads of flowers (mostly violets), cassis, black cherries, blackberries, and underlying fresh herbs. Feeling like liquid satin on the palate, it is broad, densely-packed, and has stupendous depth. A refined effort, its medium to full-bodied personality is crammed with highly-detailed black fruits and loads of exquisitely ripe tannin. In addition, the taster has the distinct feeling that this wine is holding much of its fruit in reserve...This blockbuster has it all. Projected maturity: 2007-2018. Score: 98+

my_notes: First tasted 9/2007.  Oaky, strong vanilla notes, velvety smooth

my_notes: Nice, light and refreshing.
It's $6.99 for a reason.  Bouquet is ok, no finish.  Wouldn't buy again.
Nice, light and refreshing.
Nice, light and refreshing.

Had this wine at Bizou on 6/17/04.  It was a little tight at first, but opened up into a full lush Zin that went well with the duck that LK had, and the seabass that ARM had.  It was worth going to find the next day.
other_notes: In this warm year with its scant spring rains, the York Creek vines again reached "Late Picked” levels.  We work closely with our growers to harvest at full flavor, but more moderate ripeness.  For the third consecutive year, York Creek has gone beyond that.  To add structure to the very ripe zinfandel, we have included a major amount of petite sirah.  A third of the wine aged in new and one-year-old air-dried american oak barrels, and the rest in similar, tempered oak.  Chalky tannins behind the rich fruit of this massive wine assure it continuing development.  Enjoy no, it will be at its best over the next five to seven years.
